fields.description: If you check the [JIRA Importers Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-importers-plugin] page you'll see that it's clearly stated that importing from Bugzilla and FogBugz "on-premisses" is possible, but that's not the case in OnDemand, we even have a KB article about it:  [Importing From BugZilla, FogBugz (on-premisses) Or Redmine To JIRA OnDemand|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ONDEMANDKB/Importing+From+BugZilla%2C+FogBugz+%28on-premisses%29+Or+Redmine+To+JIRA+OnDemand]
fields.summary: JIRA Importers Plugin does not allow importing from "Bugzilla" and "FogBugz on-premisses" to OnDemand but the plugin page still says it's possible

fields.description:
It would be really useful to have the [Confluence Source Editor plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor] available for Atlassian OnDemand.

Cheers,
Jeison Spaniol
fields.summary: Please make  Confluence Source Editor plugin available for Atlassian OnDemand

fields.description:
If an application is Hidden, when trying to unhide it, there is no Update button to save the changes.
(on Confluence Application Navigation only)

*Steps to reproduce:*
# go to Application Navigator in Confluence (click on top left icon and click configure)
# hide any application and save
# click edit to change the Hide value

*You see:*
!Application_Navigator_No_update_button.jpeg|thumbnail!

A JavaScript error is produced:
{panel}
uncaught exception: Unknown method: disable
https://example.jira-dev.com/wiki/s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e/en_GB-1988229788/4522/3764c7f7e98f64d5d9749fec71f9d54f6ff84d5b.2/9/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js
Line 435
{panel}
The line number seems to vary but the code it related to is in this block:
{code}
(function(){var B,G,E,C,D=/#.*/,F="active-tab",A="active-pane";AJS.tabs={setup:function(){var J;B=AJS.$(".aui-tabs:not(.aui-tabs-disabled)");for(var H=0,I=B.length;H<I;H++){J=AJS.$(B[H]);if(!J.data("aui-tab-events-bound")){G=AJS.$("ul.tabs-menu",B[H]);G.delegate("a","click",function(K){AJS.tabs.change(AJS.$(this),K);K&&K.preventDefault()});J.data("aui-tab-events-bound",true)}}AJS.$(".aui-tabs.vertical-tabs").find("a").each(function(K){E=AJS.$(this);if(!E.attr("title")){C=E.children("strong:first");if(AJS.isClipped(C)){E.attr("title",E.text())}}})},change:function(I,J){var H=AJS.$(I.attr("href").match(D)[0]);H.addClass(A).siblings().removeClass(A);I.parent("li.menu-item").addClass(F).siblings().removeClass(F);I.trigger("tabSelect",{tab:I,pane:H})}};AJS.$(AJS.tabs.setup)})();
{code}

*Expected:*
!Application_Navigator_Expected_update_button.jpeg|thumbnail!


*Notes:*
* Reproduced on other OnDemand instance.
* Was working properly on previous releases.
* Jira Application Navigation works properly.
fields.summary: Not able to unhide an Application from the Application Navigator
Subversion from Bamboo Elastic Images has been upgraded without notice.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
There is no good documentation for the Agile REST API. There is a plugin that allows you to browse the API, but it's not available for OnDemand. 

https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.labs.rest-api-browser

I'd like to have this as an OnDemand customer. We use the REST API to display key metrics on our development dashboards.
fields.summary: Add REST API browser for OnDemand customers

fields.description:
{panel:title= Implementation of New Features Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
 You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Administrators should have access to applications logs / web access logs.
h3. Workaround

Some of the user activities are available at [the audit logs - Atlassian Access|https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/track-organization-activities-from-the-audit-log/].
fields.summary: Allow administrators to have access to logs

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Have a user that only granted with JIRA only access in JIRA + Confluence OnDemand instance.
# Have a public page in Confluence.
# Login into OnDemand instance.
# Browsing the public Confluence page in the same browser will throw permission error.
fields.summary: User with application access to JIRA only is unable to browse public Confluence page in the same session

fields.description:
These are the offending pages: [Exporting issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Exporting+issues] and [Exporting wiki data|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Exporting+wiki+data].

The docs state: _*"Please note that the OnDemand service takes backups for your instance every 24 hours, so there is no need to regularly back your data up via the backup manager"*_. However, those backups are not for customer use, as per [About Your Data|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/About+Your+Data#AboutYourData-Howoftenisdatabackedup], so that information can cause friction, as the use of backup data to roll back changes to application data is not supported. Users may think they'll have a backup available after having deleted a project by accident, for example, which is not true.

As a suggestion, we could simply remove the statement, or add a link to [About Your Data|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/About+Your+Data#AboutYourData-Howoftenisdatabackedup] stating that those backups are not for customer use.
fields.summary: Documentation on taking backups in OnDemand can create friction

fields.description:
I logged this issue here as well:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-6742

Our integration with Confluence/JIRA seems to be messed up.  I don't have a link from JIRA to Confluence.  I created a custom one.

When in Confluence, the link back to JIRA is gone, I don't know how to fix that one, but this is a big issue for us as we use both sites all day long.

I need a response to this and ideally resolve the issue asap.
fields.summary: Wiki Link and Linkback are missing in our OnDemand Site

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}

fields.description: Many customers complains about the poor performance while accessing OnDemand Service from Europe (mainly from Eastern Europe) and Asia/Pacific. Since NTT (Atlassian Datacenter provider) is a global company, could be very interesting if we provide "local" OnDemand service, based on customer geo-location.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Have a user that is in a group - user that is intended to use Confluence only.
# The group shouldn't be a group that has permission in JIRA Global Permission.
# The group should allow its member to use Confluence(can use permission in Confluence Global Permission).
# Login using the user account and monitor *Login Count* in JIRA user management page.
(i) Login count won't increase.

h3. Expected result
Login count should be increased whenever a user logged into OnDemand instance.
fields.summary: User login count is not affected for users that are not in groups granted with JIRA global permissions

fields.description:
*Current*
When creating your new OnDemand instance in my.atlassian.com the administration name allows the 'Admin Username' to contain the full email address

The result is the creation of two profiles within OnDemand:
# A username with 'administrator' access - the username is the full email address e.g. johndoe@xyz.com
# A username with 'users' access - the username is the shortened username e.g. johndoe

Accessing OnDemand via google will use the 'johndoe' username, restricting your access to only 'users' functions 

*Expected*
The signup process resolves the use of a Google Apps email address within the username field and shortens the entry to the prefix. e.g. johndoe

*Workaround*
Request support.atlassian.com to update the administrator permissions on the account to ensure the prefix shortname has the correct permissions.
fields.summary: Administrators lost access after Google Apps integration with Atlassian OnDemand

fields.description:
Due to a temporary fix for a License Issue in Atlassian OnDemand, all instances are showing with a 100.000 user license limit. This is to make sure all OnDemand instances are still able to create new issues and add new Users.

*Your billing will not be affected*
This is only a temporary change within JIRA itself, your account information has not changed and you will not be charged for these extra users. All plugins will also report that they're licensed for 100.000 users, this is expected.

*Expected Fix*
A proper fix will be deployed within the next few days, once the fix has been deployed all instances will automatically return to their original license tier.\

*Resulting Tempo issue:*
For customer who are unable to use Tempo with the classic licensing, please see [this bug report|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-6703] for more information.

*Update*
We have rolled out a fix for JIRA and are now reverting all instances back to their normal licenses. If you have issues, please contact Support on https://support.atlassian.com/
fields.summary: 100.000 User License shown in OnDemand

fields.summary: Cannot create issues - user limit reached (with 7 remaining)

fields.description:
After the fix for the Licensing issue was rolled out, instances using a classic Tempo license cannot use tempo anymore as the License Tiers no longer match.

*Error message:*
Your JIRA license has a user limit of 100000 but your Tempo license has a user limit of X. The Tempo user limit must be greater than or equal to JIRAs

*Workaround*
Enable a Tempo trial from [https://my.atlassian.com], this will allow you to keep using Tempo. 

A fix is expected within the next few days. Please remember to disable the Tempo trial once the fix has been released. More information will be posted here once it is available.

*Update 1*
We are experiencing delays with our license processing systems, please note that it may take a while for the trial license to be pushed to your instance. Our teams are working on getting this resolved ASAP.

*Update 2*
The fix For JIRA has been rolled out and we're currently making sure all licenses revert back to their normal level. We're doing this slowly to avoid interrupting your usual services and to avoid slowing down the licensing changes from my.atlassian.com. We're hoping to have licenses back in order within the next day, another update will be posted once all licenses are back to normal.

*Update 3*

We have now deployed a fix for this issue. If you are still experiencing problems, please contact Support on https://support.atlassian.com/

-Once your instance is showing the normal license count again (for example 25 instead of 100.000) please cancel the Tempo trial and revert back to your old vendor purchased license.-
Please do not cancel the Tempo trial. We are identifying the affected customers and are applying a fix to ensure you receive your original license period without any service disruption.
fields.summary: Tempo not usable due to 100.000 user license in OnDemand

fields.description:
The following issue was closed as a duplicate, but not linked to the ticket it duplicated. https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-428. A search found nothing related.

Confluence will create a space every time you create a Jira project. This is generally not useful, as Product Development is a space in our Confluence instance, with products (Jira projects) being pages under that space. Really, I can't see how this is a useful feature at all, because who would have their Jira projects at the top level of their documentation hierarchy?

It would be more useful to have this configurable to:
* Create a space.
* Create a page under a particular space, or under a particular page.
* Do nothing.

I know the "supported solution" is to just delete the space, but that's a nightmare if you have more than a handful of users. Adding to our process is not a solution.
fields.summary: Choice of whether to create new Confluence space, page, or nothing when creating new Jira projects

fields.description:
Ngnix (or something between or including ngnix and the browser) is concatenating responses together. Circumstances: * opening multiple issues in multiple tabs * the first response doesn't have a "main section" in the html, indicating that an error might have occured during decoration, and that JIRA may have written out an incorrect content-length header * at the concatenation point, you clearly see "Server: ngnix". This seems like a smoking gun that it is not tomcat/jira that is doing the concatenation. * this was observed on JDOG. Not log after this observation, JDOG errored out and crashed. {code} dif]-->

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce:

# Max out JIRA application access, but not Confluence application access
# Set default application access to include both JIRA and Confluence
# Create a new user, and only grant Confluence application access during the creation i.e. do not tick JIRA application access

h4. Expected Results:

The user is created with Confluence application access only.

h4. Actual Results:

The user is created with Confluence application access only. However, OnDemand will send notification with subject "Application Access Granting Error":

{quote}
Application Access Granting Error

There was an error granting default application access to the new user 'ten'.

We were unable to grant this user access to the following application(s):

JIRA
{quote}
fields.summary: OnDemand still sends "Application Access Granting Error" notification even if quota is not violated

fields.description:
And, would it be possible to get traffic statistics on our instance. We basically would like to see the number of login. 

Thanks
fields.summary: Get # of logins on our instance

fields.description:
The Jira Macro is a great feature and will save us tons of time. However we can not use it unless it displays all the issues on the page especially in the pdf.

Using the Jira macro on a confluence page it automatically limits the amount of issues that display. And it is not configurable. 

1. Allow display all issues. (And possibly configure the amount you wish to hide.) But definitely show all issues. 

2. In order to use the export to PDF option all the issues from Jira need to populate the pdf.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Jira Macro needs Option to Show all Issues

fields.description:
Not sure whether this is the right tracker for this, but assuming https://ecosystem.atlassian.net is an OnDemand instance it seems appropriate at least:

I've received a few watch notification for [AMKT|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AMKT] issues *just closed as _Won't Fix_* by [~jkodumal] ~4 hours ago, e.g. [AMKT-4509|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AMKT-4509]/[AMKT-4510|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AMKT-4510]/[AMKT-4602|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AMKT-4602]/[AMKT-6358|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AMKT-6358] - I've visited a few issues for details now and am slightly disturbed by what I've seen:

* (x) they are *still listed with _Status=Open_ and _Resolution=Unresolved_*
* (x) likewise the last updated date seems to reflect the previous activity only
* (!) yet all issue tabs properly reflect John's closing, i.e._Comments_, _History_, _Activity_ and _Transitions Summary_ properly recorded him closing the issues as _Won't Fix_
* (i) sure enough the issues still show up as _Unresolved_ via JQL now, i.e. the current status is handled consistently at least, see e.g. 
{code}
project = "Atlassian Marketplace" and resolution = Unresolved and issuekey = AMKT-4602
{code}
* (x) other than non formerly closed open issues they don't offer the _Return to Triage_ transition anymore, so the workflow system seems to know about the intended current state _Closed_ not offering that transition in fact

How is this possible? Am I missing something or is this a severe data integrity violation?
fields.summary: Fix apparent data integrity violation with closed issues not actually being closed

fields.description:
To prevent new users from getting confused about OnDemand's 'Administrators' and 'System Administrators' global permissions, the 'JIRA System Administrators' permission should be shown within JIRA's 'Global Permissions' when an administrator user (customer) is logged in.
Since we get many support tickets from customers asking about the system administration permission. And, I believe, this friction could be reduced if the customers could see 'JIRA's System Administrator' global permission there as well, along with the 'JIRA Administrator'.
fields.summary: Add the 'JIRA System Administrators' permission when the 'Global Permissions' is viewed as an administrator

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
please, please, please can we have this added to the On Demand version of jira.

is this on your roadmap?
fields.summary: Agile User Story Map for JIRA
this is sparta

fields.description:
A Tempo Admin user "A" trying to review time for the projects they have access to gets to see how a user is spending their time on other projects that user "A" has no access to.  

If I login in as User A and pull up Tempo report I should only see information  (from work logs) for the projects User A has access to.  If this rogue user A tries to click on an issue in a project outside their purview JIRA does stop access, however User A can see Issue names etc. from the projects they do not have access on.
fields.summary: Tempo does not enforce project based display rules

fields.description:
Critical:
Because I can't roll the JIRA/Bitbucket integration out to the team - as the issue could really screw up time keeping for the project.  Is there a trick I don't know about?

Info:
I tested the following commit message to a (mercurial) repo in bitbucket that is linked with my JIRA account.

TEST-4 {color:blue}#time{color} 1w 2h 30m {color:blue}#resolve #commit{color} This msg is the commit msg.

I am using Tempo and the following problems occurred:
# The commit message does not make it to the work log message on the issue page.
## It seems obvious the commit msg should be used for the work log.
## A generic 
# The Time entered cannot be edited - this is bad.  
## I assume it does not allow editing because then it would not match the commit message in bitbucket anymore.  
## I think anyone can live with this discrepancy because there is a JIRA indication/record that the work log was edited.

Otherwise everything worked great - resolved the issue, created the work log, the link back to the commit in bitbucket.
fields.summary: JIRA Bitbucket Commit Integration

fields.description:

I tried reproducing the problem on a brand new wiki page and it worked there.

fields.description:
Currently the backup managers (both for JIRA and Confluence) allow backups to be taken as follows:
* once per 48 hours *without* attachments, and
* once per 48 hours *with* attachments.

Presumably this dual timer is to allow customers to generate a backup for migration testing, then still perform a full backup once they're ready for the final cut-over.

We are seeing the following pain-points with this current arrangement:
* From the customer's perspective, the time limit seems arbitrary and they are quite frustrated when they hit it.
* We don't say anywhere on the page that
** backups can only be generated once per 48 hours (until they try it); or
** backups with and without attachments are on different timers.
* The 48 hour timeout generally seems OK for the purpose of routine peace-of-mind backups, but not when migrating (which can be stressful enough as it is).
* Supporters have to run SQL and sometimes restart the application to clear the backup timer.

I propose that we make the following changes:
* Only limit the backup with attachments to once every 48 hours. The backup without attachments should not be restricted (new backups still overwrite old ones).
* Mention on the backup page that backups with attachments are limited to once every 48 hours, which they can see before they choose which type of backup to generate.
* Provide a button only available to system administrators that resets the backup timer, so that Support doesn't need to mess around with SQL.
fields.summary: Improve supportability of JIRA/Conf backup managers

fields.description:
If a user opens a direct link to a JIRA page that contains URL parameters 
(i.e. https://example.atlassian.net/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=10100, https://example.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/Wallboard/?dashboardId=10000) in a newly opened browser, JIRA will lose the entries after the _?_ character.

This happens in both Chrome and Firefox on both Windows and OS X.

For example, when directly linked to a dashboard they will end up in the default dashboard. When linked to a Wallboard, they'll only see empty black screen.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Log into a JIRA OnDemand instance, be sure to check "Keep me logged in"
# Create a new dashboard copy the URL for this dashboard.
# Quit the browser (not just close the window - make sure it's not running in the dock in OS X).
# Launch your browser from the command line (e.g. {{chrome.exe http://example.atlassian.net/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=10100}}) or paste the link with a parameter in a new window. 

*Result*
You are now on http://example.atlassian.net/secure/Dashboard.jspa

*Expected Result*
You should be on the dashboard linked - http://example.atlassian.net/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=10100

*Workaround*
- Keep a browser open before clicking on links from emails or external sources.
- When attempting to see a URL with a parameter, go to the instance main page first.

This only happens in OnDemand so it may be related to the login structure there.
fields.summary: When a browser is first started with a direct link to a JIRA OnDemand page, the parameters are lost

fields.description:
The '[Configuring a WebDAV client for Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Configuring+a+WebDAV+client+for+Confluence]' documentation should mention within the '[Using a WebDAV Client to Work with Pages|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Configuring+a+WebDAV+client+for+Confluence#ConfiguringaWebDAVclientforConfluence-UsingaWebDAVClienttoWorkwithPages]' section the following bug, which prevents a WebDAV directory to be mapped as a network drive on Windows Explorer: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-5858

Because, due to this bug, this method of connection (as currently described on the documentation) no longer works.
Also, the documentation should mention other methods of connection within Windows that work, like using third-party programs such as [Cyberduck|http://cyberduck.ch/] and [BitKinex|http://www.bitkinex.com/webdavclient].
fields.summary: 'Configuring a WebDAV client for Confluence' documentation should mention the bug that prevents a directory be mapped as a Network Drive in Windows

fields.description:
Invited users by email are unable to sign up. This is mainly because of the default application access setting. In fact, it's following a configuration which automatically grants access to multiple applications e.g. JIRA and Confluence at the same time. However, there is no more seats for one of the application.

h3. Scenario
An instance with JIRA *15 users* and Confluence *10 users*. Confluence user limit has been reached but JIRA still available.
Default application access for new users will grant them both JIRA and Conflunce. New users that are invited via email won't be able to signup due to the Confluence limit reached.

It would be great if users can still signup and automatically get access to the available application with available license.
fields.summary: Allow invited users to signup and granted access to the application with available license

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
Please bundle Bamboo Cobertura Plugin with Bamboo OnDemand. 

Plugin URL: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.bamboo.cobertura_bamboo
fields.summary: Please bundle Bamboo Cobertura Plugin with Bamboo OnDemand

Copied from UPM bug:

Due to a bug, customers can currently enable the AGMP "integration-jira-plugin" from the UPM even when their instance is not GApps enabled, causing "IllegalStateException: Google properties not yet initialised" errors.
The solution is to simply disable this plugin (restarting JIRA also works).

fields.description: At the 'Manage Add-ons' screen on JIRA, the Atlassian Greenhopper plugin is telling me that there is an updated version available. The version that it is telling me it's the updated it's the version 6.1.6, but it already has version 6.2.1 installed, which is a most recent version.
fields.summary: Greenhopper is telling me that there is an updated version (6.1.6), but I'm on version 6.2.1

fields.description: We have configured certain fields to use for one of our projects in Jira. Periodically, many of our fields will revert to mandatory rather than optional. The 'epic' field will also appear as mandatory on the default page, even though we have configured it so that this field will not appear on _any_ page. We suspect this coincides with updates to the Jira software, but any insight you can offer would help.
fields.summary: Epic default field

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
Please bundle the [SU for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.dolby.atlassian.jira.jirasu] plugin on OnDemand platform.
fields.summary: Bundle the SU for JIRA plugin on OnDemand platform

fields.description:
In OnDemand's [Creating Issues and Comments from Email|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email] documentation there's a section called [Best practices (pre-processing JIRA email messages)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email#CreatingIssuesandCommentsfromEmail-Bestpractices(pre-processingJIRAemailmessages)]. On that section the user is presented with a list of email rules used to better filter auto-reply messages, the only detail is that those rules cannot be applied on JIRA's OnDemand *Default* mail server, as that mail server is not configurable outside what's available on the UI. 

The rules outlined there can only be applied if the customer have a secondary POP / IMAP mail server, and it should be applied on the email server itself, not on the users instance. Clarifying those two points would reduce friction.
fields.summary: Edit documentation on Best practices for pre-processing JIRA email messages.

fields.description:
Hello,

The user Jason Horton in my system is not able to close issues. I have looked at our permission scheme and he is in the group of Product Manager who are able to close issues. I have looked everywhere and haven't been able to identify the issue.

Could you help me?
Thank you!
fields.summary: Permission Issue - No permission to close issues

fields.description: JIRA has Gravatar support, which is AWESOME! But Confluence should sync Gravitar, or for that matter, any Profile Picture from JIRA.
fields.summary: Link Profile Pics between JIRA and Confluence

fields.description: We have many different issue types in our Jira On Demand system. We would like only certain resolutions to apply to certain issue types. Currently, this can't be done, but it would be nice if it could, perhaps with schemes?
fields.summary: Create schemes for Resolutions

fields.description: We have many different issue types in our Jira On Demand system. We would like only certain priorities to apply to certain issue types. Currently, this can't be done, but it would be nice if it could, perhaps with schemes?
fields.summary: Create schemes for Priorities

fields.description:
Hi

With Confluence OnDemand, we appear to be having a problem with URL links not landing on the page after login. 

For our KB at:
https://contentserv.atlassian.net/wiki/display/KB/KNOWLEDGE+BASE+Home

If we click a link to the KB from a e-mail or insert the link in a browser (IE, Firefox, Opera and Chrome see screenshot), after login the URL link appears but with contentserv.atlassian.net/wiki added in front of the link, 
i.e. contentserv.atlassian.net/wikihttps://contentserv.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=KB&title=Marketing+Information

On other Spaces, this issue (double URLs after login) does not seem to appear.

1. The difference between "other Spaces" and our KB Space is that part of the KB Space has "anonymous" pages.

2. This problem appears to have started this week, as the user complains only started this week!!

I have NOT identified whats causing this problem, but if you could help here,

please check
fields.summary: Confluence OnDemand URLs not landing on link page after login; URL is doubled up!!

fields.description:
The current version of JIRA Timesheet plugin on OnDemand is 2.3.15, and it seems that are logs of bugs in this version, that were corrected in version 2.4.

Please upgrade the JIRA Timesheet plugin to version 2.4, so it can work properly on OnDemand.
fields.summary: Update the JIRA Timesheet plugin to version 2.4

FishEye and Crucible - 500 Server Error

-Currently this requires the reinstallation of the latest release for OnDemand.  Please raise a request via support.atlassian.com for your instance for this to be arranged.  There will be loss of access for 10-15 minutes while this occurs.-

fields.summary: Fisheye & Crucible generate 500 error after weekly upgrade

fields.description:
Currently in OnDemand, it is only possible to export 1000 issues at a time to excel.

See [Export More Than 1000 Results to Excel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Export+More+Than+1000+Results+to+Excel] on Atlassian documentation. It is possible to change the default limit, but it is a permission restricted in OnDemand.
fields.summary: Allow more than 1000 issues to be exported to excel at a time in OnDemand.

fields.description:
I don't have any metric for this, but I received a number of complaints from my team members that it appears our instance is slow for them.  The reason I am filing a bug report is because of the number of complaints.

We have about half of our users are complaining that the instance is slow.

If anyone can check the instance's performance (load on the physical server or RAM usage) that would be great.  Thanks.
fields.summary: Our OnDemand Instance appears to be slow
